issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I have the following in my instance resolv.conf and am seeing that lookups for names with "-" character are failing to be pinged, oddly enough nslookup works. I believe [~dshekhawat] is seeing the same behavior:

{code}
root@euca-192-168-116-25:~# nslookup repo.jenkins-ci.org
Server:         10.0.1.91
Address:        10.0.1.91#53

Non-authoritative answer:
Name:   artifactoryonline-com-1665998254.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com
Address: 107.23.26.55
Name:   artifactoryonline-com-1665998254.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com
Address: 107.23.74.195
Name:   artifactoryonline-com-1665998254.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com
Address: 107.23.88.175

root@euca-192-168-116-25:~# ping repo.jenkins-ci.org
ping: unknown host repo.jenkins-ci.org
root@euca-192-168-116-25:~# cat /etc/resolv.conf
# Dynamic resolv.conf(5) file for glibc resolver(3) generated by resolvconf(8)
#     DO NOT EDIT THIS FILE BY HAND -- YOUR CHANGES WILL BE OVERWRITTEN
nameserver 10.0.1.91
nameserver 8.8.8.8
search eucalyptus
root@euca-192-168-116-25:~#
{code}
fields.summary: DNS Names with "-" in them unable to resolve through CLC

comments.body:
[~viglesias] is correct, we tried with hypens in domain names and they are failing. We are now working on doing this test i.e.

Have resolv.conf of instance point to upstream DNS server that ideally would/should delegate the eucalyptus specific domain to the CLC, because in our test it is clear if we have the upstream DNS in resolv.conf it works.

So have the upstream DNS do everything for non euca names and for euca names do the thing which it does via the delegation.

Please let us know if there are any questions.

[~viglesias] and [~dshekhawat]:  I suspect that the issue has to do w/ CNAME resolution and not "-"s in the name.  The correct response should look like the following -- note the CNAME entry and subsequent AUTHORITY and ADDITIONAL sections:
{code}
;; QUESTION SECTION:
;repo.jenkins-ci.org.		IN	A

;; ANSWER SECTION:
repo.jenkins-ci.org.	1850	IN	CNAME	jenkinsci.jfrog.org.
jenkinsci.jfrog.org.	300	IN	CNAME	artifactoryonline-com-1665998254.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com.
artifactoryonline-com-1665998254.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com. 1	IN A 107.23.74.195
artifactoryonline-com-1665998254.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com. 1	IN A 107.23.88.175
artifactoryonline-com-1665998254.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com. 1	IN A 107.23.26.55

;; AUTHORITY SECTION:
artifactoryonline-com-1665998254.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com. 271 IN NS	ns-916.amazon.com.

;; ADDITIONAL SECTION:
ns-916.amazon.com.	344	IN	A	207.171.178.7
{code}

If you do not want to use recursive resolution you may disable it by setting system.dns.recursive.enabled = false.

Verified that I am now able to hit the addresses with CNAMES but I am having the same issue with MX records such as mx.yahoo.com. 

Also in the logs I am seeing the following message streaming at WARN level which I assume is related to the code not upgrading properly on nightlies. Is the code in there to add these fields on a supported upgrade and new install?
{code}
2013-05-26 21:38:55  WARN 000000232 StaticPropertyEntry      | Failed to get property: experimental.dns.enabled because of example: [StaticDatabasePropertyEnt
ry fieldName=com.eucalyptus.util.dns.DnsResolvers.enabled value=null propName=experimental.dns.enabled id=null version=null creationTimestamp=null lastUpdateT
imestamp=null naturalId=null]
{code}

MX works for me. Please make sure that the resolvers are picked up at startup.

root@euca-172-26-32-42:~# dig  yahoo.com MX

; <<>> DiG 9.8.1-P1 <<>> yahoo.com MX
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 56349
;; flags: qr rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 3, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 0

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;yahoo.com.			IN	MX

;; ANSWER SECTION:
yahoo.com.		1732	IN	MX	1 mta6.am0.yahoodns.net.
yahoo.com.		1732	IN	MX	1 mta7.am0.yahoodns.net.
yahoo.com.		1732	IN	MX	1 mta5.am0.yahoodns.net.

;; Query time: 86 msec
;; SERVER: 10.111.1.53#53(10.111.1.53)
;; WHEN: Mon May 27 22:09:46 2013
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 106

Hmm, it resolves for me, but can't ping when the eucalyptus nameserver is used. Here are the differences.

root@euca-172-26-32-42:~# dig mx.yahoo.com

; <<>> DiG 9.8.1-P1 <<>> mx.yahoo.com
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 53655
;; flags: qr rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 6, AUTHORITY: 2, ADDITIONAL: 2

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;mx.yahoo.com.			IN	A

;; ANSWER SECTION:
mx.yahoo.com.		289	IN	CNAME	fd-fp3.wg1.b.yahoo.com.
ds-fp3.wg1.b.yahoo.com.	49	IN	CNAME	ds-any-fp3-lfb.wa1.b.yahoo.com.
ds-any-fp3-lfb.wa1.b.yahoo.com.	289 IN	CNAME	ds-any-fp3-real.wa1.b.yahoo.com.
fd-fp3.wg1.b.yahoo.com.	289	IN	CNAME	ds-fp3.wg1.b.yahoo.com.
ds-any-fp3-real.wa1.b.yahoo.com. 49 IN	A	98.138.253.109
ds-any-fp3-real.wa1.b.yahoo.com. 49 IN	A	206.190.36.45

;; AUTHORITY SECTION:
wa1.b.yahoo.com.	1607	IN	NS	yf1.yahoo.com.
wa1.b.yahoo.com.	1607	IN	NS	yf2.yahoo.com.

;; ADDITIONAL SECTION:
yf1.yahoo.com.		527	IN	A	68.142.254.15
yf2.yahoo.com.		527	IN	A	68.180.130.15

;; Query time: 65 msec
;; SERVER: 10.111.1.53#53(10.111.1.53)
;; WHEN: Mon May 27 22:20:29 2013
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 241


root@euca-172-26-32-42:~# dig @8.8.8.8 mx.yahoo.com

; <<>> DiG 9.8.1-P1 <<>> @8.8.8.8 mx.yahoo.com
; (1 server found)
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 47498
;; flags: qr rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 5, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 0

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;mx.yahoo.com.			IN	A

;; ANSWER SECTION:
mx.yahoo.com.		249	IN	CNAME	fd-fp3.wg1.b.yahoo.com.
fd-fp3.wg1.b.yahoo.com.	250	IN	CNAME	ds-fp3.wg1.b.yahoo.com.
ds-fp3.wg1.b.yahoo.com.	10	IN	CNAME	ds-any-fp3-lfb.wa1.b.yahoo.com.
ds-any-fp3-lfb.wa1.b.yahoo.com.	250 IN	CNAME	ds-any-fp3-real.wa1.b.yahoo.com.
ds-any-fp3-real.wa1.b.yahoo.com. 10 IN	A	206.190.36.45

;; Query time: 53 msec
;; SERVER: 8.8.8.8#53(8.8.8.8)
;; WHEN: Mon May 27 22:22:53 2013
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 157
The only thing I can see w/ the response that is anything of note is maybe the two A records instead of one.  Checking...

It looks like the CNAME chain is in the wrong order in our response.  Left is ours, right is correct:

{code}
13,18c13,18
< mx.yahoo.com.		300	IN	CNAME	fd-fp3.wg1.b.yahoo.com.
< ds-fp3.wg1.b.yahoo.com.	15	IN	CNAME	ds-any-fp3-lfb.wa1.b.yahoo.com.
< ds-any-fp3-lfb.wa1.b.yahoo.com.	300 IN	CNAME	ds-any-fp3-real.wa1.b.yahoo.com.
< fd-fp3.wg1.b.yahoo.com.	300	IN	CNAME	ds-fp3.wg1.b.yahoo.com.
< ds-any-fp3-real.wa1.b.yahoo.com. 15 IN	A	98.138.253.109
< ds-any-fp3-real.wa1.b.yahoo.com. 15 IN	A	206.190.36.45
---
> mx.yahoo.com.		290	IN	CNAME	fd-fp3.wg1.b.yahoo.com.
> fd-fp3.wg1.b.yahoo.com.	290	IN	CNAME	ds-fp3.wg1.b.yahoo.com.
> ds-fp3.wg1.b.yahoo.com.	5	IN	CNAME	ds-any-fp3-lfb.wa1.b.yahoo.com.
> ds-any-fp3-lfb.wa1.b.yahoo.com.	290 IN	CNAME	ds-any-fp3-real.wa1.b.yahoo.com.
> ds-any-fp3-real.wa1.b.yahoo.com. 5 IN	A	98.138.253.109
> ds-any-fp3-real.wa1.b.yahoo.com. 5 IN	A	206.190.36.45
{code}

The following commit fixes the ANSWER record ordering issue and the property naming conflicts indicated here.

{code}
commit 33aeb389af6b0ac7fd745a7d50e07b93431ca77d
Author: chris grzegorczyk <grze@eucalyptus.com>
Date:   Mon May 27 20:32:35 2013 -0700

    Fixes to DNS support in EUCA-6379
    
    - Recursive DNS returns CNAME records in the correct order.
    - Recursive DNS always returns a populated Authority and Additional section.
    - Property names adjusted to account conflict in displayName handling.
    - euca-describe-properties properly shows descritptions when passed -v|--verbose flag.
    - Adjusted properties with their descriptions are:
    
     clc 420 > euca-describe-properties experimental.dns -v
    PROPERTY        experimental.dns.enabled        true
    DESCRIPTION     experimental.dns.enabled        Enable pluggable DNS resolvers.  Note: This must be 'true' for any pluggable resolver to work.  Also, each resolver may need to be separately 
    PROPERTY        experimental.dns.recursive.enabled      true
    DESCRIPTION     experimental.dns.recursive.enabled      Enable the recursive DNS resolver.  Note: experimental.dns.enable must also be 'true'
    PROPERTY        experimental.dns.services.enabled       true
    DESCRIPTION     experimental.dns.services.enabled       Enable the service topology resolver.  Note: experimental.dns.enable must also be 'true'
    PROPERTY        experimental.dns.split_horizon.enabled  true
    DESCRIPTION     experimental.dns.split_horizon.enabled  Enable the split-horizon DNS resolution for internal instance public DNS name queries.  Note: experimental.dns.enable must also be 'tr
{code}
Note that while {{dig}} {{host}} and {{nslookup}} may successfully return some values, the test case which reliably will fail when this problem occurs is {{ping}} .
Verified we are now working as expected and no longer seeing the error message in the log on a clean upgrade.
